cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSE of Ocean City, Maryland
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-to-north-northeast along the Mid-Atlantic coast, then inland across New Jersey toward southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the New Jersey coast (near Cape May to central NJ)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape May, NJ to Watch Hill, RI, including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Delaware and New Jersey coasts northward through New York, Connecticut and Rhode Island
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–50 mph with higher gusts) possible Friday afternoon into Friday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding (generally 1–2 ft) possible at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated amounts up to 7 inches could fall over the port area, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out Friday afternoon and evening
